sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均有"确实地，真正地"之意。
means: indeed ： 一般用于肯定或证实对方所说的话，多承接前言，也用来加强或肯定自己说话的语气。
really ： 主要用于强调与事实或现实不相违背，也可表示不快、惊奇或某种含蓄的怀疑。
truly ： 强调客观存在的真实性，没有任何虚假。
actually ： 侧重于实际的事，而不是凭空想象或推测的事。

sentence.Network_en: He actually became convinced that the nurses had an unanswerable case.
sentence.Network_cn: 他实际上已经相信了护士们的情况确实如此。

sentence.Network_en: They actually moved down from upstairs because the rent's that expensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们确实从楼上搬到了楼下，因为房租太贵了。

sentence.Network_en: He will actually be serving three concurrent five-year sentences.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际上，他将服3个5年徒刑，合并执行。

entry.def: You use actually to indicate that a situation exists or happened, or to emphasize that it is true.

example.ex: One afternoon, I grew bored and actually fell asleep for a few minutes...
example.tran: 一天下午，我觉得有些无聊，还真的睡着了一小会儿。

example.ex: Interest is only payable on the amount actually borrowed.
example.tran: 利息只能根据实际借款数目给付。

entry.tran: （用于纠正他人或表示反对）实际上，事实上
entry.def: You use actually when you are correcting or contradicting someone.

example.ex: No, I'm not a student. I'm a doctor, actually...
example.tran: 不，我不是学生。实际上我是医生。

example.ex: 'So it's not a family show then?' —'Well, actually, I think that's exactly what it is.'
example.tran: “那么这并不是一次家庭才艺表演了？”——“嗯，事实上我觉得这恰恰就是一次家庭才艺表演。”

entry.tran: (礼貌地表达与他人的期待所不同的观点)说实在的，说真的
entry.def: You can use actually when you are politely expressing an opinion that other people might not have expected from you.

example.ex: 'Do you think it's a good idea to socialize with one's patients?' — 'Actually, I do, I think it's a great idea.'
example.tran: “你认为和自己的病人交朋友的想法好吗？”——“说实在的，我认为很好，这个想法很棒。”

example.ex: I would be surprised, actually, if he left Birmingham.
example.tran: 如果他要离开伯明翰，说真的，我会很惊讶。

entry.def: You use actually to introduce a new topic into a conversation.

example.ex: Well actually, John, I rang you for some advice...
example.tran: 这么说吧，约翰，我给你打电话是想得到些建议。

example.ex: Actually, let's just read this little bit where you've made them bump into each other.
example.tran: 这样吧，我们就只读你让他们偶遇这一小段吧。

sentences.sentence: "to be nominally but not actually independent"
"large meteorites actually come from the asteroid belt"

means.word_mean: 2. used to imply that one would expect the fact to be the opposite of that stated; surprisingly;

sentences.sentence: "you may actually be doing the right thing by walking out"
"they thought they made the rules but in reality they were only puppets"
"people who seem stand-offish are in reality often simply nervous"

means.word_mean: 3. as a sentence modifier to add slight emphasis;

sentences.sentence: "actually, we all help clear up after a meal"
"she hasn't proved to be too satisfactory, actually"
"the transmission screen shows the picture that is actually on the air"

auth_sentence.res_content: This guy's actually one of the whispering bats.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This guy's actually one of the whispering bats.

auth_sentence.content: They actually make quite a big thing of it.
auth_sentence.res_content: They actually make quite a big thing of it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They actually make quite a big thing of it.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,表示"……的",通常在在名词后.; 2. 表副词,放在形容词后,"……地"

stems_affixes.word_buile: come来+ly……的→翩翩而来→美丽动人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 昂贵的,价值高的,豪华的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cost代价+ly……的→adj.昂贵的,价值高的,豪华的
drizz毛毛雨+ly……的→adj.毛毛雨的[a drizzly day]
friend朋友+ly……的→adj.友好的,友谊的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很可能的,合适的,可靠的
stems_affixes.word_buile: like像+ly……的→adj.很可能的,合适的,可靠的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 活泼的,活跃的;栩栩如生的,真实的
stems_affixes.word_buile: live活+ly……的→adj.活泼的,活跃的;栩栩如生的,真实的
man男人+ly……的→adj.男子气概的,果断的
niggard小气鬼+ly……的→adj.吝啬的,勉强的
otherworld超世+ly……的→adj.超脱尘世的,超俗的
spindle细长的人[或物]+ly……的→spindly细长的,纤弱的
time时间+ly……的→adj.及时的,适时的
week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊
continuous连续的+ly……的→adv.不断地,连续地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 幸福地,愉快地,恰当地,幸亏
stems_affixes.word_buile: happy快乐的,幸福的+ly……的→happily幸福地
active积极的+ly……地→adv.活跃地,积极地
week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊
according相符的+ly……地→adv.因此,从而
final最后的+ly……地→adv.最后,终于

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际上,事实上,竟然,居然,如今

consequent作为结果的+ly……地→adv.从而,因此
anxious担忧的+ly……地→adv.忧虑地,不安地
biological[adj.生物学的]+ly……地→adv.生物学上

chief主要的+ly……地→adv.首要,主要地
commercial商业的+ly……地→adv.商业上,通商上

unfortunate不幸的+ly……地→adv.不幸地

week周+ly……的→adj.每星期的,一周的 adv.每周一次 n.周刊,周报
month月+ly……的→adj.每月的 adv.每月一次,按月 n.月刊

Sentence.sentence: Publishers give us all of the source media, artwork, videos," he says, "We help them think through how to actually build something for this platform.
Whether digitally interactive ones like Inkling actually take off or not remains to be seen, and we probably won't have a definite answer for the next few years
Now they're actually eager to see their electricity bills.
texting is actually a new kind of talking, with its own kind of grammar and conventions.
It doesn't actually mean "laughing out loud" in a literal sense anymore
Worldwide people speak differently from the way they write, and texting -quick, casual and only intended to be read once — is actually a way of talking with your fingers.

sentences.en: She looks young, but she’s actually 50.
sentences.cn: 她看上去年轻,可是实际上已五十岁了。

sentences.en: But will you actually receive the money?
sentences.cn: 但你真的会收到这笔钱吗？

sentences.en: That’s the only reason I’m actually going.
sentences.cn: 这是我确实要走的惟一理由。

sentences.en: A man’s vanity is actually in proportion to his ignorance.
sentences.cn: 一个人的虚荣心实际上是和他的愚蠢程度成正比。

sentences.en: Actually Christmas Day is not the day on which Jesus Christ was born.
sentences.cn: 事实上,圣诞节并不是耶稣基督诞生的日子。

sentences.en: Actually, it is not the case.
sentences.cn: 实际上,情况不是这样的。

sentences.en: Aluminium looks heavy but actually it is very light.
sentences.cn: 铝看起来很重,实际上却很轻。

sentences.en: Conducting business with her is fine but I find that actually conversing with her is quite difficult.
sentences.cn: 和她做生意很愉快,但我发觉和她交谈实在困难。

sentences.en: Mary asks what you actually want her to do.
sentences.cn: 玛丽问的是你到底想让她做什么事。

sentences.en: Did you actually see the UFO?
sentences.cn: 你真的见到不明飞行物了吗?

sentences.en: Did he actually say in so many words that there was no hope of a cure?
Our turnover actually increased last year.
sentences.cn: 去年我们的营业额竟然增加了。

sentences.en: She was so angry that she actually tore up the letter.
sentences.cn: 她一气之下竟然将信撕碎了。

sentences.en: She actually considered fresh air harmful.
sentences.cn: 她竟然认为新鲜空气有害。

sentences.en: Everyone in the office complains that he smells awful but nobody dares actually mention it to him.
sentences.cn: 办公室里的每个人都说他身上有股怪味,但居然没有敢当面向他提及。

sentences.en: He made that decision actually by drawing lots.
sentences.cn: 他居然用抽签的方法做出那项决定。
